subject: Entity-manager: Update AssetTag using association
commitMessage:
Entity-manager: Update AssetTag using association

AssetTag is an updateable property from User level interface like
Redfish. User-level interface will update Asset tag in entity-manager,
which will further update the needed FRU interface property exposed.

Following are changes added to make AssetTag Updatable:
1. Probe Path(FRU Path) is added in the compiled json file to use
   while creating association.
2. Created association between the entity manager object path
   and probe Path(FRU Path).
3. Updatable properties under entity manager interface are mapped
   to the properties under FruDevice interface using configuration
   files.
4. Interfaces containing properties with templatized property values
   are considered as writable.
5. To update AssetTag value, get the FRU device object path
   using associations and property name is taken from map.
6. Handled failure in updating property of FRU.

Tested:
Successfully updated in assetTag interface as well as in fru interface
while using set-property and using redfish as well.
The new value is preserved after BMC resets.

Signed-off-by: Archana-Kakani <archanax.kakani@linux.intel.com>
Change-Id: Id2e4fac8fbbe693c181e061f28222d9bec890d06

The design is now based on Association.
Although, this can be achieved without association as well.

Please don't use blocking calls in an async daemon.  use async_method_call or getProperty

To handle the fru updation failure, return value of the set property is required. Unable to get return value using async_method_call, so did synchronous call. Made necessary changes to make it asynchronous without calling async_method_call.
This method suffers from the same issues as above.
Addressed the issue.

entity-manager should not be enforcing this check.  If we don't want to allow setting a specific field, then FruDevice should be the one to enforce that, and entity-manager should simply propogate the appropriate error code back up the chain.
Storing the writable interfaces by parsing the config data and using it.

This is still just a blocking call then.
I understand it needs to be blocking so you can get the return value for the D-Bus property set handler. I don't know the preferred solution here - either standard synchronous calls, or coroutines? - but this use of std::async doesn't make sense.

Thank you for the comment Jonathan. Removed the blocking call by avoiding the use of return value of Fru Device property updation. Asset Tag Property of EntityManager service is always updated based on the property change under Fru Device.

Instantiate a timer object, and set callbacks for both the timer expiring, and the call completing.  Today we don't use futures or std::launch async.  By using std::async, you're breaking multi-threaded locking by accessing a bunch of data structure from an un-mutexed thread.
Removed the use of std::async completely. Request you to review the patch 12 with latest changes.
